sourceMeaningMnemonic: You take <radical>gold</radical> in exchange for executing <radical>orders</radical> to construct a <kanji>buzzer</kanji>. You are a <kanji>small bell</kanji> maker and someone orders you to make one into a buzzer in exchange for some gold. This is how you make a living.
meaningInfo: Imagine the gold, heavy in your pockets, as you construct this buzzer with your bare hands. Feel the cool metal clink around in your hands as you put it together.
readingMnemonic: Finally the <kanji>buzzer</kanji> is done. You’ve earned your gold. You test the buzzer and it goes <reading>rin</reading>g (<ja>りん</ja>)! Ring! Ring! Ring! Ring ring ring ring ring! Man, that ringing is annoying but hey, that’s what buzzers do.
readingInfo: Wait, should this buzzer be buzzing or ringing? Oh well, you got your gold. It’s the client’s problem now.
